plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A small perennial flowering plant known for its early spring blooms that often emerge through the snow. It features cup-shaped flowers with bright colors.
plants.location: Temperate regions of Europe and Western Asia
plants.funFact: Crocus flowers are some of the first signs of spring, sometimes blooming as early as February, and they're related to the saffron crocus used as a spice.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub celebrated for its large, showy flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its lush foliage and striking blooms are popular in gardens.
plants.location: East Asia (Japan, China, Korea) and cultivated worldwide in mild climates
plants.funFact: Camellias were introduced to Europe in the 18th century and have since become beloved ornamental plants, symbolizing admiration and perfection.

plants.name: Mahonia aquifolium
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub with holly-like leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers appearing in late winter, followed by blue-black berries.
plants.funFact: Oregon grape is the state flower of Oregon and its berries are edible, often used to make jelly.

plants.name: Mimosa pudica
plants.description: A tropical plant famous for its delicate pink spherical flowers and leaves that fold inward when touched or shaken.
plants.bloomingSeason: December to March in tropical climates
plants.location: Native to South America, grown in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Its rapid leaf movement is a defense mechanism to deter herbivores and minimize damage from environmental stress.
